qas.question: Along with Northern and Maay, what is the third main group of Somali dialects?
What dialect is Standard Somali based on?
What is another name for Benaadir?
What dialect is spoken on Mogadishu?
In what geographic part of Somalia do the Rahanweyn live?

context: Somali dialects are divided into three main groups: Northern, <a0_0>Benaadir<a0_0/> and Maay. <a1_0>Northern Somali<a1_0/> (or Northern-Central Somali) forms the basis for Standard Somali. <a3_0>Benaadir<a3_0/> (also known as <a2_0>Coastal Somali<a2_0/>) is spoken on the Benadir coast from Adale to south of Merca, including Mogadishu, as well as in the immediate hinterland. The coastal dialects have additional phonemes which do not exist in Standard Somali. Maay is principally spoken by the Digil and Mirifle (Rahanweyn) clans in the <a4_0>southern<a4_0/> areas of Somalia.
